name: Cupid aka "love is blind", a dev crit HiPS Archer with huge damages : bard 9 / SD 2 / AA 29
author: Pan Draconis

posts.author: Pan Draconis
posts.content:
Cupidon (Cupidon means Cupid in french) aka "love is blind", a dev crit HiPS Archer with huge damages : bard 9 / SD 2 / AA 29

I'm in dev crit HiPs builds now, so here's another one with low melee defense, but strong ranged presence.

Backstory : 

Wikipedia : In classical mythology, Cupid is the god of desire, erotic love, attraction and affection. He is often portrayed as the son of the love goddess Venus and the god of war Mars. He is also known in Latin as Amor ("Love"). His Greek counterpart is Eros. Although Eros is generally portrayed as a slender winged youth in Classical Greek art, during the Hellenistic period, he was increasingly portrayed as a chubby boy. During this time, his iconography acquired the bow and arrow that represent his source of power: a person, or even a deity, who is shot by Cupid's arrow is filled with uncontrollable desire.

This dude is as Cupid, you can't see him and his arrows are filled with unctrollable desire, but not a desire to love, a desire to die.


Source

Explanation of the build : 

The aim of the build was to build an archer with Hips, dev crit, and good damages. There's many ways to get enough strengh and AB with an archer to get dev crit. The RDD way (bard RDD AA fo exemple, or bard AA fighter, but you can't get HiPS here). The only way for HiPS and dev crit is Bard AA Shadowdancer. AA gives you ranged AB + heavy damages, SD gives you HiPS, evasion and uncanny dodge to secure your dex AC.
The build is very adaptable, this version is juste one of mine. You can choose less dex, more strenght according to the dev crit DC and AB and AC you prefer, depending on your playstyle and game environement. The gameplay is focused on HiPs since your AC and HP are low, stay in the shadows and strike them all. Use scrolls and wands with UMD for the hardest fights.

Hips, full AA, ranged dev crit, good damages, reflex saves, evasion, uncanny dodge, full UMD.

Cons :
low AC, low HP.

Recommanded items : dex and strenght items, bow with a strenght bonus to damages, + saves items. P.S. :  do not fight naked as the true Cupid(on).

Variations : If you want more saves against spells, switch some UMD points with spellcraft points. You can switch between dex and strght for more AB or more dev crit DC (depends on the fort saves of the ennemis of your environement)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
If you're playing a ranged specialist with HiPS you shouldn't really be worrying about low HPs and AC. Unless you're doing it all wrong, of course!

EDIT: Also (forgot to mention before), I really prefer Spot over Listen for ranged builds. I know Bard doesn't get it, but AA does. While I'm at it, with 2 pretty horrid saves as is, some Spellcraft would have been nice to see. Pick Pocket is a bit of a luxury, and you over-egg the UMD somewhat for a Bard build - unless you want it for using items rather than scrolls - so I reckon you could squeeze some in.

posts.author: Pan Draconis
posts.content:
Thanks for the input, you're right about spot. Listen was a melee choice, a pavlovian reflex due to the habit !
Pick Pocket is an omission from an old version of the build. About UMD, I use it for items and scrolls, but to save some skills point for spellcraft here is a real good idea. I'm gonna edit the first post.
